article_title: Expanded Medicaid reducing emergency room use in California
article_text:
Expanded Medicaid reducing emergency room use in California Giving poor working people access to doctors brings down health care costs for all

Photo: David McNew, Getty Images LOS ANGELES, CA - JULY 10: Nurse Allison Miller checks the blood... Texas hospitals and doctors have been prescribing health insurance for the working poor as a solution to skyrocketing health care costs for years. New evidence from California shows that it works.

To continue reading this story, you will need to be a digital subscriber to HoustonChronicle.com. Houston Chronicle subscribers have FREE access to all premium digital products.

og.description: Texas hospitals and doctors have been begging state lawmakers to expand Medicaid to cover the working poor for years, promising cost savings for all. A new study looking at expanded Medicaid in California finds that it works.
og.title: Expanded Medicaid reducing emergency room use in California

Expanded Medicaid reducing emergency room use in California Giving poor working people access to doctors brings down health care costs for allPhoto: David McNew, Getty Images LOS ANGELES, CA - JULY 10: Nurse Allison Miller checks the blood... Texas hospitals and doctors have been prescribing health insurance for the working poor as a solution to skyrocketing health care costs for years.
New evidence from California shows that it works.
